title: Low Air Pressure Warning

likely_causes.notes: Listen for hissing; use soapy water to locate leaks.
May fail to build pressure to cut-out.
Can cause slow build or over/under pressure.

likely_causes.cause: Air dryer purge valve stuck open

recommended_checks: Do not drive if pressure cannot reach safe range.
Check build-up time to 85–100 PSI (per OEM spec).
Inspect compressor, governor, dryer purge, and system leaks.
Drain tanks for water/oil contamination.
safety_warning: Low air pressure can cause brake failure. Stop and repair before driving.

title: Air Pressure Builds Up Slowly
symptom_short: Air gauge rises very slowly after start

likely_causes.cause: Air dryer restriction or saturated desiccant

recommended_checks: Perform leak-down test (service + parking brake applied).
Check compressor intake/filter and lines.
Verify governor cut-in/cut-out and compressor output.
Inspect air dryer cartridge and purge function.
safety_warning: Slow build may indicate a leak; can lead to low-pressure brake loss.

title: Compressor Runs Constantly / No Cut-Out
symptom_short: Air keeps climbing or never reaches cut-out
recommended_checks: Verify cut-out pressure per truck spec.
Inspect governor lines and unloader operation.
Check dryer signal line for blockage/leaks.
safety_warning: Overpressure is dangerous; do not operate until governor/unloader verified.

title: Air Dryer Purges Too Often
recommended_checks: Check for air leaks first.
Confirm governor cut-in/cut-out spacing.
Inspect purge valve for leakage.
Service dryer cartridge per interval.
safety_warning: Frequent cycling can lead to low-air events and moisture in tanks.

title: Water / Oil in Air Tanks
symptom_short: Water or oily sludge drains from tanks

likely_causes.notes: Oil can damage valves and brake components.

recommended_checks: Drain all tanks and note amount of water/oil.
Inspect/replace dryer cartridge and check purge.
Check compressor for excessive oil carryover.
Inspect brake valves and lines for contamination.
safety_warning: Moisture can freeze in lines; oil contamination can cause brake malfunction.

title: Parking Brake Won’t Release
symptom_short: Spring brakes stay applied or release slowly

likely_causes.cause: Air leak in spring brake chamber/lines
Mechanical failure in brake chamber or linkage

recommended_checks: Confirm air pressure is within safe range.
Listen for leaks near chambers/valves.
If freezing suspected: warm truck safely; service dryer and drain tanks.
Inspect chambers and slack adjusters.
safety_warning: Never cage a spring brake unless trained and following manufacturer procedure.

title: Trailer Brakes Not Working / Weak
symptom_short: Trailer brakes weak or not applying

likely_causes.cause: Gladhands/air lines connected incorrectly or leaking
likely_causes.notes: Service/emergency lines reversed can cause dangerous behavior.

likely_causes.cause: Trailer spring brakes applied due to low air

recommended_checks: Verify gladhand colors and correct connection.
Check for leaks at couplers and hoses.
Confirm trailer supply valve open and air pressure present.
Scan for trailer ABS faults if applicable.
safety_warning: Do not haul if trailer braking is compromised—high risk of jackknife.

title: Brakes Dragging / Overheating
symptom_short: Brakes smell hot, wheels heat up, truck pulls

likely_causes.cause: Slack adjuster out of adjustment or seized
Stuck relay valve or quick release valve
Frozen or damaged brake chamber pushrod

recommended_checks: Safely check wheel temps (IR thermometer).
Inspect slack adjusters, cams, and return springs.
Check relay/quick release valves for sticking.
Inspect linings/drums/rotors for contamination and damage.
safety_warning: Overheated brakes can fade or start a fire. Stop immediately if severe.

title: Air Leak Only When Brakes Applied
symptom_short: Hissing occurs only when pressing brake pedal
recommended_checks: Apply brakes and pinpoint leak location.
Inspect chambers for audible leak at vent hole.
Check foot valve and relay valves for leakage.
Perform leak-down test and compare to spec.
safety_warning: A chamber diaphragm leak can cause sudden brake loss. Repair before driving.

title: ABS Light On (Truck/Trailer)

likely_causes.cause: Wheel speed sensor or tone ring issue

recommended_checks: Note whether truck or trailer ABS lamp is on.
Inspect sensors/tone rings for debris/damage.
Check wiring and connector pins for corrosion.
Pull ABS codes using compatible scan tool.
safety_warning: Base brakes still work, but stability control/ABS may be reduced—drive cautiously until fixed.

title: Service Brake Feels Soft / Long Travel
symptom_short: Brake pedal travel is long or response delayed
symptom_patterns: brake pedal long travel air brakes

likely_causes.cause: Brake adjustment out of spec (slack adjusters)

recommended_checks: Verify primary/secondary air pressure within spec.
Inspect slack adjuster stroke length (measure).
Check for leaks during brake application.
Inspect foot valve and relay valves.
safety_warning: Long pedal travel can mean insufficient braking force—unsafe to continue driving.
